001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc.cli;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
005import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcMessage;
006import org.consensusj.jsonrpc.JsonRpcRequest;
007import org.slf4j.Logger;
008import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
009
010import java.util.List;
011
012/**
013 * Parser for command-line JSON-RPC method and parameters
014 */
015public class CliParameterParser {
016    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(CliParameterParser.class);
017    private final ObjectMapper mapper;
018    private final JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion;
019
020    public CliParameterParser(JsonRpcMessage.Version jsonRpcVersion, ObjectMapper mapper) {
021        this.jsonRpcVersion = jsonRpcVersion;
022        this.mapper = mapper;
023    }
024
025    public CliParameterParser(ObjectMapper mapper) {
026        this(JsonRpcMessage.Version.V2, mapper);
027    }
028
029    /**
030     * Parse command-line arguments (after options, etc. have been processed/removed)
031     * @param args the JSON-RPC method name followed by JSON-RPC parameters as JSON strings
032     * @return A request ready for serialization and sending
033     */
034    public JsonRpcRequest parse(List<String> args) {
035        String method = args.get(0);
036        List<String> unparsedParams = args.stream().skip(1).toList();
037        List<CliParameter> convertedArgs = parseParamList(method, unparsedParams);
038        if (convertedArgs.stream().anyMatch(CliParameter::invalid)) {
039            throw new JsonRpcClientTool.ToolException(1, "One or more invalid JSON-RPC parameters");
040        }
041        List<Object> typedArgs = convertedArgs.stream()
042                .flatMap(CliParameter::stream)
043                .toList();
044        return new JsonRpcRequest(jsonRpcVersion, method, typedArgs);
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * Convert params from strings to Java types that will map to correct JSON types
049     *
050     * @param method the JSON-RPC method
051     * @param params Params with String type
052     * @return Params with correct Java types for JSON
053     */
054    private List<CliParameter> parseParamList(String method, List<String> params) {
055        return params.stream()
056                .map(this::parseParam)
057                .peek(this::logInvalid)
058                .toList();
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * Convert a single param from a command-line option {@code String} to a type more appropriate
063     * for serialization by Jackson/JSON-RPC.
064     *
065     * @param param A string parameter to convert
066     * @return A wrapped Java Object that can serialize to JSON
067     */
068    private CliParameter parseParam(String param) {
069        CliParameter mappedParam = mapParam(param);
070        return mappedParam.valid()
071                ? mappedParam                         // Param was valid JSON
072                : CliParameter.valid(param, param);   // Handle string with no quotes as {@code String}
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * Map a single param from a command-line {@code String} to a {@link JsonNode} wrapped
077     * in a {@link CliParameter}.
078     *
079     * @param param A string parameter to convert
080     * @return A wrapped Java Object that can serialize to JSON (or a wrapped exception)
081     */
082    private CliParameter mapParam(String param) {
083        return CliParameter.parse(param, string -> mapper.readValue(param, JsonNode.class));
084    }
085
086    private void logInvalid(CliParameter param) {
087        if (param instanceof CliParameter.Invalid i) {
088            log.error("Invalid parameter", i.error());
089        }
090    }
091}
